_header: All thing in kind desireth thing I-like
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1988)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse Printed 1476-1558. London: Mansell, 1988, TP 114.5.
_description: John Lydgate, ‘Rime without Accord’ or ‘On the Inconsistency of Men’s Actions’ — usually eleven 8-line stanzas with refrain

BLHar2251.First Lines:
All thyng in kynde desirith thyng IlikeBut the contrary hatis euery
                    thyng…
BLHar2251.Last Lines:
…And bryng vs al to thyn enheritauncewith thi precious bloode
                    as thow vs bought
BLHar2251.Editions:
Halliwell-Phillipps,  James Orchard,
                        ed.  
             A Selection from the Minor Poems of Don John Lydgate.
Percy Society
         2. London: T. Richard, 1840: 2.55-8.
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. II: Secular Poems.
EETS
         o.s. 192 (1934); repr. 1961: 792-4.

CamMagPep2553.First Lines: All thyng in kynde desirith thyng I like…
CamMagPep2553.Editions:
Craigie,  William Alexander. 
             The Maitland Folio Manuscript, Containing Poems by Sir Richard
                Maitland, Dunbar, Douglas, Henryson, and others.
             2 vols. 
             Scottish Text Society
         n.s. 7 (1919), 20 (1927); Edinburgh and London: Blackwood, 1919,
            1927: 1.195-6.

Banna.First Lines:
Thingis in kynd desyris thingis lykeBot discontrair haitis Every
                    thing…
Banna.Last Lines:
…a wantoun hird and a weill rewlit flokIt may weill ryme bot
                    it accordis nocht
Banna.Note: Stanzas 1-5, 8 in disarranged order, plus two more stanzas.
